captions.text:
The Peterborough Patriots
versus the Charlestown Chiefs,

brought to you by
Sheehan's Rustproofing.

The Chiefs have come out
on the ice for a warm-up period.

They're about to try
for their fifth consecutive win.
They're applauded by their booster club,

who have travelled all the way
from Charlestown to be here tonight.

There's no one to stop it because
there are no officials on the ice.

What has come over
the Charlestown Chiefs?
That our flag was still there

I got my eye on you.
You pull one thing, you're out.

I run a clean game.
Any trouble, I'll suspend you.
I'm listening to the fucking song!
O'er the land of the free

title: Pre-Game Brawl - Slap Shot (7/10) Movie CLIP (1977) HD

me while I was warming up and intentionally shouldered me and it was on.

anytime soon. ﻿

the equipment doesn't do much in the nfl your opponent runs into your chest 
with their head ay 20mph while they weigh over 200 pounds football the goal 
isn't to go around it's through over 4000 concussions have occurred 
(lawsuits only too)   nfl in the ncaa football is 4th in concussions behind 
mens ice hockey (3rd) mens wrestling (2nd) and woman's ice hockey (1st) 
football has the most average concussions a year at over 60 while rugby had 
a lot less didn't even make the list
comments.author: tyson symes

comments.text:
you've never played rugby then...its a dirty mean-hearted sport. I am not 
saying the NFL ain't ruff but I've played both sports when I was younger. I 
quit rugby because I spent so much time unconscious.

You proved my point when you say that they wear all that protective 
equipment. You dont have that luxury in Rugby. Football is Football and 
Rugby is Football + Backyard Brawling. You get kicked, punched, headbutted 
and 1 time (for me) bit in those scrimmages. 

Football is more  fun to play tho  though and enjoyable to watch though. 
And a rough sport. Those guys are tuff, I am not denying it. 

But its jmho...you might be right.

comments.text:
That league had a ton of gimmicks, I still remember the Baltimore Blades 
which were created just to finish out the Michigan Stags season and owned 
by the league, played only 20 games in that city and won 2.   Made the 
Washington Capitals down I 95 look like world beaters.  After that season 
they were folded and Charm City went back to minor league hockey.
